abstract: Memo from Nairobi; countries across Africa struggle to deal with protests, political instability and economic problems suddenly overshadowing previously high economic growth rates that fed 'Africa rising' narrative across continent and world; Ethiopia, shining example of narrative, is now under government-imposed state of emergency, with much of its infrastructure burned in protests against government.

headline.print_headline: ‘Africa Rising’? ‘Africa Reeling’ May Be a More Fitting Slogan These Days
headline.main: ‘Africa Rising’? ‘Africa Reeling’ May Be More Fitting Now

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject

snippet: Protests, civil war and economic problems are undermining a recent belief that the African continent was in a period of strong economic growth....
lead_paragraph: Protests, civil war and economic problems are undermining a recent belief that the African continent was in a period of strong economic growth.
